intro: Castanopsis rockii, commonly known as the Chinese stone栎, is a deciduous evergreen tree native to China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and chestnuts, and is characterized by its hard, dense wood. The tree produces small, spiny fruits that contain one or two seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Castanopsis rockii typically grows in mountainous regions and is adapted to acidic soils. It plays an important role in the ecological systems of its native habitat.
